article_title: Economy heading south, says increasing number of Northwest business owners
article_text:
78 percent of small-business owners in the Pacific Northwest say their own businesses are doing OK

Affordable Care Act saved money or had no financial effect for 60 percent of owners

article_metadata.description: Union Bank released the results of its annual Small Business Economic Survey, and business owners in the Pacific Northwest, it turns out, “are more pessimistic about the national economy in 2016 than last year,” and “while they have strong confidence in their own businesses, optimism that their businesses are headed in the right direction has also declined,” the survey said.
article_metadata.title: Economy heading south, says increasing number of Northwest business owners | The News Tribune
